engineersdecor.config.title: Engineer's Decor Config
engineersdecor.tooltip.massive_speed_boo: Apply RF power to magnificently increase the speed.
engineersdecor.tooltip.slabpickup.help: §rFast pickup by left-clicking while looking up/down and holding this slab.
block.engineersdecor.clinker_brick_block:
§6A brick block with position dependent texture variations.§r
Looks slightly darker and more color intensive than the vanilla brick block.
§6Slab made from a Clinker Block.§r
Looks slightly darker and more color intensive than the vanilla brick.
block.engineersdecor.clinker_brick_stain:
§6A brick block with position dependent texture variations.§r
Looks slightly darker and more color intensive than the vanilla brick block. Has more visible traces of grime or stain.
§6Slab made from a Stained Clinker Block.
§6Looks slightly darker and more color intensive than the vanilla brick block. Has more visible traces of grime or stain.
block.engineersdecor.clinker_brick_stair: §6Looks slightly darker and more color intensive than the vanilla brick block.
block.engineersdecor.dense_grit_dirt_blo: §6A compressed dirt-like soil, plain texture with some cracks.§r Known from often used paths or trampled yard grounds. Dirt and coarse dirt can be mixed in for accentuation. Position dependent texture variations. Prevents grass spreading.
block.engineersdecor.dense_grit_sand_blo: §6A compressed sandy soil mixed with stone grid, as known from machine and storage yards.§r Flowers don't really grow on that. Position dependent texture variations.
block.engineersdecor.factory_dropper.hel: §6Dropper suitable for advanced factory automation.§r Has twelve round-robin selected slots. Drop force, angle, stack size, and cool-down delay adjustable using sliders in the GUI. Three stack compare slots (below the inventory slots) with logical AND or OR can be used as internal trigger source. The internal trigger can be AND'ed or OR'ed with the external redstone signal trigger. Trigger simulation buttons for testing. Pre-opens shutter door when internal trigger conditions are met. Drops all matching stacks simultaneously. Simply click on all elements in the GUI to see how it works.
block.engineersdecor.factory_dropper.too:
External signal combination logic (AND or OR)§r
§8AND: Drop only on an external signal.
OR: Drop filter matches automatically, non-matching items on external trigger.

Filter combination gate logic (AND or OR)§r
§8AND: Drop the stacks as specified in the filters when ALL filters are green.
OR: Drop the stack of each individual filter when green.

External Redstone signal indicator
§8(click to generate a test trigger).

Trigger mode (pulse/continuous)§r
§8Pulse: One drop for each OFF->ON of the external signal.
Continuous: Drop as long as the external signal is ON.
block.engineersdecor.factory_hopper.help:
§6Hopper suitable for advanced factory automation.§r Can transfer half-stacks, max collection range 9x9.
GUI Slider controls: Collection range (0 to 4), insertion delay (0.5s to 10s), insertion stack size (1 to 32).
GUI Redstone controls: Not inverted / inverted (default), pulse mode / continuous mode (default).
block.engineersdecor.factory_hopper.tool:
Delay indicator
§8Blinks when the insertion delay timer has not expired yet, or when the Hopper cannot insert into the adjacent inventory.
block.engineersdecor.factory_placer.help:
§6Allows placing blocks and planting crops or trees.§r
GUI Redstone controls: Not inverted / inverted (default), pulse mode / continuous mode (default).
Also supports spike planing from underneath the soil. Spits out items that it cannot place or plant.
block.engineersdecor.fluid_barrel.help:
§6Simple barrel for storing liquids.§r Has a small built-in pressure-tube based level gauge.
Default placement is standing, sneak-place to select a specific direction, transfers fluids in tanks below when standing. Supports fluid extraction/insertion as item and Comparator output.
block.engineersdecor.gas_concrete.help: §6Low hardness, high production yield concrete.§r Easy to break decorative concrete block.
block.engineersdecor.gas_concrete_slab.h: §6Low hardness concrete slab.§r Easy to break decorative concrete.
block.engineersdecor.gas_concrete_stairs: §6Low hardness concrete stairs.§r Easy to break decorative concrete.
block.engineersdecor.gas_concrete_wall.h: §6Low hardness concrete wall.§r Easy to break decorative concrete.
block.engineersdecor.halfslab_gas_concre: §6Vertically stackable slice.§r Right/left click with the slice stack on the top or bottom surface to add/remove slices.
block.engineersdecor.halfslab_rebar_conc: §6Vertically stackable slice.§r Right/left click with the slice stack on the top or bottom surface to add/remove slices.
block.engineersdecor.halfslab_sheetmetal: §6Vertically stackable slice.§r Right/left click with the slice stack on the top or bottom surface to add/remove slices.
§6Vertically stackable slice.§r Right/left click with the slice stack on the top or bottom surface to add/remove slices.
§6Vertically stackable slice.§r Right/left click with the slice stack on the top or bottom surface to add/remove slices.
§6Vertically stackable slice.§r Right/left click with the slice stack on the top or bottom surface to add/remove slices.
§6Vertically stackable slice.§r Right/left click with the slice stack on the top or bottom surface to add/remove slices.
block.engineersdecor.halfslab_treated_wo: §6Vertically stackable slice.§r Right/left click with the slice stack on the top or bottom surface to add/remove slices.
block.engineersdecor.iron_bulb_light.hel: §6Small glowstone light source§r, placed on the ceiling, walls, fence posts or metal poles.
block.engineersdecor.iron_ceiling_edge_l: §6Small glowstone light source§r, placed at the edge of a ceiling block.
block.engineersdecor.iron_floor_edge_lig:
§6Small glowstone light source, placed at the edge of a floor block.§r
Useful to light up places where electrical light installations are problematic.
block.engineersdecor.iron_hatch.help: §6An upside down trapdoor,§r placed above mainenance shafts or ladders. Creeper-proof, functions as ladder when open.
block.engineersdecor.iron_inset_light.he:
§6Small glowstone light source, sunk into the floor, ceiling or wall.§r
Useful to light up places where electrical light installations are problematic.
block.engineersdecor.labeled_crate.help:
§6A storage crate with 9x6 slots and a built-in item frame at the front.§r
Place an item into the frame slot at the bottom right of the GUI to define the shown label.
block.engineersdecor.labeled_crate.tip:
§6Label:§r %1$s
%2$s slots used / %3$s free
%4$s total items stored
block.engineersdecor.metal_rung_ladder.h: §6Typical industrial wall ladder, consisting of horizontal metal rod rungs.§r Look up/down to climb faster.
block.engineersdecor.metal_rung_steps.he: §6Staggered rod rungs affixed to a wall, allowing to climb up, fall down, and so on.§r Look up/down to climb faster.
block.engineersdecor.panzerglass_block.h: §6Reinforced glass block.§r Expensive, explosion-proof. Dark gray tint, faint structural lines visible, multi texture for seemless look.
block.engineersdecor.panzerglass_slab.he: §6Reinforced glass slab.§r Expensive, explosion-proof. Dark gray tint, faint structural lines visible.
block.engineersdecor.rebar_concrete.help: §6Steel reinforced concrete block.§r Expensive but Creeper-proof like obsidian.
block.engineersdecor.rebar_concrete_slab: §6Steel reinforced concrete slab.§r Expensive but Creeper-proof like obsidian.
block.engineersdecor.rebar_concrete_stai: §6Steel reinforced concrete stairs.§r Expensive but Creeper-proof like obsidian.
block.engineersdecor.rebar_concrete_tile: §6Steel reinforced concrete tile.§r Expensive but Creeper-proof like obsidian.
§6Steel reinforced concrete tile slab.§r Expensive but Creeper-proof like obsidian.
§6Steel reinforced concrete tile stairs.§r Expensive but Creeper-proof like obsidian.
block.engineersdecor.rebar_concrete_wall: §6Steel reinforced concrete wall.§r Expensive but Creeper-proof like obsidian.
block.engineersdecor.sign_decor.help: §6This should not be craftable or visible in JEI. Used for creative tab and screenshots.
block.engineersdecor.sign_defense.help: §6Warning sign for turrets, Tesla Coils, and traps.
block.engineersdecor.sign_factoryarea.he: §6Marker sign for buildings or areas where the really big machines are located.
block.engineersdecor.sign_hotwire.help: §6Electrical hazard warning. Don't forget to place around HV, or you will have a nonconformity in the next audit.
block.engineersdecor.slag_brick_block.he: §6A gray-brown brick block with position dependent texture variations.
block.engineersdecor.small_block_breaker:
§6Breaks blocks in front of it.§r
Can be disabled by applying a redstone signal. The time needed to destroy a block depends on the hardness of that block. ${!block_breaker_requires_power?engineersdecor.tooltip.massive_speed_boost_with_rf_power} ${block_breaker_requires_power?engineersdecor.tooltip.requires_rf_power}
block.engineersdecor.small_electrical_fu: §6Small metal cased pass-through furnace.§r Automatically draws items from the input side and puts items into the inventory at the output side. Items can be inserted or drawn from all sides using hoppers. Implicitly bypasses items that cannot be smelted or cooked to the output. Slightly more energy efficient and faster than a heated cobblestone furnace. Fifos and feeders transfer whole stacks. Feeders require a bit of power.

Auxiliary slot
§8Place a Hopper here to enable automatic feeding from the input side.
§6Collects fluids above it.§r Has an internal tank with three buckets capacity. Traces flowing fluids to nearby source blocks. The fluid can be obtained with fluid transfer systems or a bucket. Fills only tanks below (gravity transfer). Compatible with vanilla infinite-water-source creation.
block.engineersdecor.small_lab_furnace.h: §6Small metal cased lab kiln.§r Solid fuel consuming, updraught. Slightly hotter and better isolated than a cobblestone furnace, therefore more efficient. Two auxiliary slots e.g. for storage. Two stack internal hopper fifos for input, output, and fuel. Place an external heater into a aux slot and connect power for electrical smelting speed boost.
block.engineersdecor.small_milking_machi:
§6Occasionally milks cows.§r
Has an internal fluid tank. Does not feed the animals. Use buckets to retrieve the milk. Pulls/stores milk container items from/to inventories at the back or bottom (preferrs extracting from the back and inserting below, but can also put filled vessels back into the same inventory). Supports fluid output to tanks or pipes below (only if milk exists as fluid). Care that it's not too crowdy in the cow pen, only happy animals stroll by voluntarily.
block.engineersdecor.small_mineral_smelt:
§6High temperature, high insulation electrical stone melting furnace.§r
Heats up mineral blocks to magma blocks, and finally to lava. Click with a mineral block (stone, cobble, etc) or use item insertion to place a block in the melter. Use bucket or fluid extraction to retrieve the lava. When cooling down lava, obsidian is generated. Remove the RF power or apply a redstone signal to disable the furnace. For automation, use a redstone comparator to see in which melting phase the mineral is a moment.
block.engineersdecor.small_solar_panel.h:
§6Produces a small amount of power when exposed to sunlight.§r
Useful for charging LF capacitors in remote systems with low consumption. The internal charge pump circuit accumulates and frequently transfers RF. Production depends on day time and the weather.
block.engineersdecor.small_tree_cutter.h:
§6Chops grown trees in front of it.§r
Does not collect the lumbers. Deactivate with a redstone signal. ${!tree_cuttter_requires_power?engineersdecor.tooltip.massive_speed_boost_with_rf_power} ${tree_cuttter_requires_power?engineersdecor.tooltip.requires_rf_power}
block.engineersdecor.small_waste_inciner: §6Trash with internal fifo slots.§r Items can be inserted on all sides, and are kept until there is no space left in the fifo. After that the oldest stack will be incinerated. Apply electrical RF/FE power to increase the processing speed. Keeps its inventory when being relocated.
block.engineersdecor.steel_floor_grating: §6Decorative steel floor covering.§r Top aligned. Items fall through.
block.engineersdecor.steel_framed_window: §6Steel framed triple glazed window. Well insulating. §r Does not connect to adjacent blocks like glass panes.
block.engineersdecor.steel_mesh_fence.he:
§6Industrial style fence.§r
Does not connect do regular fences.
block.engineersdecor.steel_mesh_fence_ga:
§6Industrial style fence gate that fits well to the Steel Mesh Fence.§r
Can be placed as single or double size gate.
block.engineersdecor.straight_pipe_valve: §6Straight fluid pipe fragment.§r Conducts fluids only in one direction. Does not connect to the sides. Reduces flow rate. Sneak to place in reverse direction.
§6Straight fluid pipe fragment.§r Conducts fluids only in one direction. Does not connect to the sides. Sneak to place in reverse direction. Blocks if not redstone powered.

§6Straight fluid pipe fragment.§r Conducts fluids only in one direction. Does not connect to the sides. Sneak to place in reverse direction. Blocks if not redstone powered, reduces the flow rate linear from power 1 to 14, opens to maximum possible valve flow rate for power 15.
block.engineersdecor.testblock.help: §6Uncraftable mod testing block with changing experimental functionality. DO NOT USE, may even cause a crash in the worst case!!
block.engineersdecor.thick_steel_pole.he: §6Straight hollow pole fragment (6x6x16) for structural support purposes.
block.engineersdecor.thick_steel_pole_he: §6Steel part fitting as foot or head of the thick steel pole (6x6x16).
block.engineersdecor.thin_steel_pole.hel: §6Straight hollow pole fragment (4x4x16) for structural support purposes.
block.engineersdecor.thin_steel_pole_hea: §6Steel part fitting as foot or head of the thin steel pole (4x4x16).
block.engineersdecor.treated_wood_crafti:
§6Decorative crafting table with advanced features.§r Eighteen storage slots, keeps inventory, no vanilla recipe book.
Click up/down arrow buttons for crafting history selection, output slot for item placement, X-button to clear crafting grid and history. Shift-click stack: player-to-storage stack transfer when crafting grid empty, otherwise player-to-grid stack transfer. Automatically distributes the clicked stack. Shift-Ctrl-click stack: Move all same stacks. Mouse wheel over crafting slot: Increase/decrease crafting grid items.
block.engineersdecor.treated_wood_ladder: §6Weather-proof wooden ladder.§r Look up/down to climb faster.
block.engineersdecor.treated_wood_pole.h:
§6Straight pole fragment with a diameter of a wire relay.§r
Can be useful as alternative to the wire posts if special lengths are needed, or as support for structures.
block.engineersdecor.treated_wood_pole_h: §6Wooden part fitting as foot or head of straight poles.
block.engineersdecor.treated_wood_pole_s: §6Heavy duty wooden support part fitting as foot or head of straight poles.
§6Robust Wood Stool.§r Indoor and outdoor use.
§6Robust four-legged wood table.§r Indoor and outdoor use.
block.engineersdecor.treated_wood_window: §6Wood framed triple glazed window. Well insulating.§r Does not connect to adjacent blocks like glass panes.
